test_cases.description: Patient required reoperation due to hardware complication.

test_cases.description: Unplanned admission due to surgical site infection post-AIS surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T12:00Z]: Patient presents with increased back pain and fever 8 days post-operative for adolescent idiopathic scoliosis. Surgical site shows erythema and drainage. Admitted for observation and IV antibiotics.

required_provenance: Surgical site shows erythema and drainage.
Admitted for observation and IV antibiotics.

test_cases.description: Patient developed surgical site infection after discharge.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T09:30Z]: The patient, a 17-year-old male, returned to the clinic with erythema and purulent drainage from the surgical site. He underwent scoliosis correction surgery three weeks ago. The antibiotic prophylaxis timing was not documented, and the wound drainage was noted, indicating a potential surgical site infection. The patient was advised on proper wound care but had unclear instructions at discharge.

required_provenance: erythema and purulent drainage from the surgical site
The antibiotic prophylaxis timing was not documented
had unclear instructions at discharge

test_cases.description: Patient required return to OR for hardware complication.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T11:15Z]: The patient, a 16-year-old female, was readmitted with acute onset of back pain and impaired mobility. Imaging revealed a loss of reduction of the spinal hardware. The initial procedure was lengthy, and there was no documentation of the surgical pause. The patient was taken back to the OR for hardware revision.

required_provenance: loss of reduction of the spinal hardware
there was no documentation of the surgical pause

test_cases.description: Patient developed surgical site infection due to delayed antibiotic prophylaxis.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T14:00Z]: The patient, a 17-year-old male with idiopathic scoliosis, underwent surgery where antibiotic prophylaxis was not administered within the recommended timeframe. Post-operatively, he developed a surgical site infection, necessitating further intervention. This raises concerns about compliance with antibiotic protocols.

required_provenance: developed a surgical site infection
antibiotic prophylaxis was not administered within the recommended timeframe

test_cases.description: Delayed discharge due to inadequate discharge instructions leading to readmission.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T16:30Z]: The patient, a 16-year-old girl post-surgery for idiopathic scoliosis, was readmitted 10 days after discharge due to confusion about post-operative care instructions. The discharge instructions were unclear, leading to medication errors and subsequent complications that required hospitalization.

required_provenance: readmitted 10 days after discharge
discharge instructions were unclear

test_cases.description: Patient required reoperation due to hardware complication.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T11:00Z]: A 14-year-old boy with idiopathic scoliosis presented with worsening back pain and signs of hardware failure. Imaging revealed loss of reduction, leading to an urgent reoperation. This situation highlights the importance of regular follow-ups and monitoring for hardware integrity post-surgery.

required_provenance: loss of reduction, leading to an urgent reoperation
worsening back pain

test_cases.description: Post-operative ileus leading to unplanned admission.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-06T08:00Z]: The patient, a 15-year-old female with a history of idiopathic scoliosis, was discharged post-surgery but readmitted 5 days later due to gastrointestinal complications, specifically an ileus. This suggests a lack of adequate bowel regimen post-operatively, which could have been prevented.

required_provenance: readmitted 5 days later due to gastrointestinal complications, specifically an ileus
a lack of adequate bowel regimen post-operatively

test_cases.description: Patient developed a surgical site infection post scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T09:00Z]: The patient, a 17-year-old male, was readmitted 10 days after spinal fusion for idiopathic scoliosis. It was noted that the antibiotic prophylaxis was not administered timely during the initial procedure.

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to GI complications after scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T14:00Z]: A 16-year-old female was readmitted 7 days post-operation for severe abdominal pain and vomiting. Imaging indicated signs of ileus. The documentation lacked details on the bowel regimen prescribed at discharge, which may have contributed to the patient's GI complications.

The documentation lacked details on the bowel regimen prescribed

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to hardware complications after scoliosis surgery.

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted with surgical site infection post scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T11:30Z]: Patient John Smith, a 14-year-old male, presented for unplanned readmission on January 3rd with fever and wound erythema. Evaluation confirmed a surgical site infection, likely due to inadequate antibiotic prophylaxis timing during the initial surgery.

required_provenance: surgical site infection
likely due to inadequate antibiotic prophylaxis timing

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted with complications due to lack of follow-up planning.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-06T16:00Z]: Patient Sarah Davis, a 17-year-old female, presented for readmission on January 6th. The clinical review indicated complications that arose from insufficient discharge planning and follow-up instructions.

required_provenance: insufficient discharge planning and follow-up instructions

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to surgical site infection following idiopathic scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T09:00Z]: Patient was discharged on post-operative day 4 after successful correction of scoliosis. They returned to the ER with fever and increasing pain at the surgical site. Wound examination revealed erythema and purulent drainage, indicating a surgical site infection.

required_provenance: Wound examination revealed erythema and purulent drainage, indicating a surgical site infection.
They returned to the ER with fever and increasing pain at the surgical site.

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted due to uncontrolled pain after discharge following spinal surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T14:00Z]: The patient was discharged after a successful scoliosis correction surgery. Upon return, they reported pain levels that continued to escalate despite medications. A review of discharge instructions revealed unclear pain management guidelines.

required_provenance: Upon return, they reported pain levels that continued to escalate despite medications.
A review of discharge instructions revealed unclear pain management guidelines.

test_cases.description: Patient experienced hardware complications necessitating return to OR post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T11:30Z]: The patient was discharged on post-operative day 6. They returned with severe back pain and imaging confirmed hardware failure at the surgical site. The surgical team did not adequately assess potential hardware issues during the discharge planning.

required_provenance: They returned with severe back pain and imaging confirmed hardware failure at the surgical site.
imaging confirmed hardware failure at the surgical site.

test_cases.description: Patient returned to OR for additional intervention due to unexpected complications.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-06T08:30Z]: After discharge following scoliosis surgery, the patient experienced increasing pain and was found to have a hematoma requiring surgical intervention. The pre-operative assessment did not adequately address potential bleeding risks.

required_provenance: the patient experienced increasing pain and was found to have a hematoma requiring surgical intervention.
The pre-operative assessment did not adequately address potential bleeding risks.

test_cases.description: A 15-year-old girl with idiopathic scoliosis develops a surgical site infection post-operatively due to inadequate antibiotic timing.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-01T08:30Z]: Patient presented for scoliosis surgery at 14:00. Antibiotics were administered at 14:30, which was 30 minutes after incision start. Post-operative day 3, the patient showed signs of redness and drainage from the surgical site.

required_provenance: Antibiotics were administered at 14:30, which was 30 minutes after incision start.
the patient showed signs of redness and drainage from the surgical site.

test_cases.description: A 14-year-old girl is readmitted with GI complications after scoliosis surgery due to lack of bowel regimen.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T11:00Z]: Post-operative day 6, the patient was readmitted with nausea and abdominal distension. Review of discharge instructions revealed no bowel regimen was prescribed.

required_provenance: the patient was readmitted with nausea and abdominal distension.
no bowel regimen was prescribed.

test_cases.description: A 15-year-old boy requires a return to OR due to hardware complication from inadequate discharge planning.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T13:00Z]: Patient underwent scoliosis correction surgery on 12/28. On post-operative day 10, he returned to OR for hardware adjustment due to shifting reported by family, which was never addressed in discharge instructions.

required_provenance: returned to OR for hardware adjustment due to shifting
which was never addressed in discharge instructions.

test_cases.description: A 17-year-old girl is readmitted with pneumonia after scoliosis surgery due to poor follow-up planning.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T14:00Z]: Patient had scoliosis surgery on 12/29. On post-operative day 8, she presented with fever and cough. The review indicated inadequate follow-up planning as no appointments were scheduled for post-discharge.

required_provenance: presented with fever and cough.
inadequate follow-up planning as no appointments were scheduled for post-discharge.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding post-operative pain management and patient comfort.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-02T11:00Z]: Patient reports significant pain post-surgery, requiring increased analgesics beyond the prescribed regimen.

[Nurse 2025-01-02T13:00Z]: Patient states pain is manageable and denies any need for additional pain medication.

required_provenance: requiring increased analgesics beyond the prescribed regimen
Patient states pain is manageable and denies any need for additional pain medication.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding antibiotic prophylaxis timing.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[Surgeon 2025-01-04T14:00Z]: Antibiotic prophylaxis administered 30 minutes prior to incision as per protocol.

[Pharmacist 2025-01-04T14:30Z]: Antibiotic not administered until after incision due to surgeon's directive.

required_provenance: Antibiotic prophylaxis administered 30 minutes prior to incision as per protocol.
Antibiotic not administered until after incision due to surgeon's directive.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding patient discharge instructions clarity.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-05T10:00Z]: Discharge instructions provided verbally and in writing; patient understood the follow-up care.

[Nurse 2025-01-05T11:00Z]: Patient expressed confusion about post-operative care and follow-up appointments.

required_provenance: Discharge instructions provided verbally and in writing; patient understood the follow-up care.
Patient expressed confusion about post-operative care and follow-up appointments.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes regarding surgical site infection (SSI) indicators.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-06T08:00Z]: Wound appears clean with no signs of infection; patient stable.

[Nurse 2025-01-06T09:00Z]: Wound drainage noted with erythema around the incision site.

required_provenance: Wound appears clean with no signs of infection; patient stable.
Wound drainage noted with erythema around the incision site.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes on post-operative pain management.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-02T09:00Z]: Patient reports pain at a level 8 out of 10, requiring increased analgesics. Pain management plan needs adjustment.

[RN 2025-01-02T14:00Z]: Patient is comfortable and denies any pain. Current analgesics are adequate.

required_provenance: Patient reports pain at a level 8 out of 10, requiring increased analgesics.
Patient is comfortable and denies any pain.

test_cases.description: Contradictory notes on discharge instructions clarity.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-03T10:00Z]: Discharge instructions given clearly, patient understands medication regime.

[RN 2025-01-03T12:00Z]: Patient appears confused about discharge instructions regarding medication and follow-up.

required_provenance: Discharge instructions given clearly, patient understands medication regime.
Patient appears confused about discharge instructions regarding medication and follow-up.

test_cases.description: Inconsistent notes regarding post-operative infection signs.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-04T11:00Z]: Wound site appears clean with no signs of infection.

[RN 2025-01-04T15:00Z]: Noticed erythema and drainage from the wound site, possible signs of infection.

required_provenance: Wound site appears clean with no signs of infection.
Noticed erythema and drainage from the wound site, possible signs of infection.

test_cases.description: Conflicting assessments on neurovascular status.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-05T09:30Z]: Neurovascular exam shows intact sensation and good perfusion.

[RN 2025-01-05T10:30Z]: Patient exhibits signs of paresthesia, and perfusion status is not described as pink/warm.

required_provenance: Neurovascular exam shows intact sensation and good perfusion.
Patient exhibits signs of paresthesia, and perfusion status is not described as pink/warm.

test_cases.description: Dissonance in documentation of complications post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload:
[MD 2025-01-06T08:00Z]: Patient is stable with no signs of complications post-surgery.

[RN 2025-01-06T09:00Z]: Patient is experiencing increasing back pain, indicating a possible complication.

required_provenance: Patient is stable with no signs of complications post-surgery.
Patient is experiencing increasing back pain, indicating a possible complication.

test_cases.description: Conflicting notes on the patient's postoperative condition leading to readmission.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T09:30Z]: Postoperative assessment indicated the patient was stable with no signs of infection at the surgical site. However, the patient's mother expressed concerns about increasing redness and drainage.

required_provenance: the patient was stable with no signs of infection
increasing redness and drainage

test_cases.description: Patient with fever and abdominal pain post-surgery, unrelated to scoliosis procedure.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T12:00Z]: The patient presented with a fever of 101°F and complaints of abdominal pain. A thorough assessment was conducted and it was determined that these symptoms were consistent with a viral gastroenteritis, unrelated to the surgical site or the recent scoliosis surgery.

required_provenance: unrelated to the surgical site or the recent scoliosis surgery.

test_cases.description: Patient presenting with headaches post-surgery, diagnosed with migraine.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-07T09:15Z]: The patient reported severe headaches following the scoliosis surgery. After further investigation, it was confirmed that these were migraine headaches, not indicative of any post-operative complications.

required_provenance: not indicative of any post-operative complications.

test_cases.description: Patient with transient numbness in the extremities post-surgery, diagnosed as transient ischemic attack.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-08T11:45Z]: Upon assessment, the patient experienced transient numbness in the extremities. Neurological consult revealed this to be a transient ischemic attack, which is unrelated to the scoliosis surgery.

required_provenance: unrelated to the scoliosis surgery.

test_cases.description: Patient with nausea and vomiting post-surgery, diagnosed with gastroesophageal reflux.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-09T16:00Z]: The patient reported nausea and vomiting after discharge. Gastroenterology evaluation indicated that these symptoms were due to gastroesophageal reflux and not linked to the recent scoliosis surgery.

required_provenance: not linked to the recent scoliosis surgery.

test_cases.description: Patient presented with unrelated viral infection post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T11:00Z]: Patient was readmitted with fever and malaise. Workup revealed a viral upper respiratory infection, unrelated to the recent spinal surgery.

required_provenance: Patient was readmitted with fever and malaise.

test_cases.description: Patient with chronic back pain exacerbated, unrelated to surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T12:30Z]: Upon follow-up, the patient reported increased back pain due to chronic arthritis flares, not related to surgical site.

required_provenance: the patient reported increased back pain due to chronic arthritis flares

test_cases.description: Readmission due to unrelated gastrointestinal issue.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T09:00Z]: The patient was readmitted for an unrelated GI obstruction, which was noted to be a pre-existing condition.

required_provenance: The patient was readmitted for an unrelated GI obstruction

test_cases.description: Post-operative admission due to unrelated urinary retention.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T14:15Z]: Patient was admitted for urinary retention attributed to pre-existing benign prostatic hyperplasia, not related to the surgery.

required_provenance: admitted for urinary retention attributed to pre-existing benign prostatic hyperplasia

test_cases.description: Readmission due to respiratory distress unrelated to surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-06T16:45Z]: Patient presented with respiratory distress due to asthma exacerbation, which was unrelated to the recent spinal surgery.

required_provenance: presented with respiratory distress due to asthma exacerbation

[PA 2025-01-01T13:15Z]: Wound drainage noted with mild erythema around the incision site.

[CRNA 2025-01-01T14:05Z]: Antibiotic administration occurred after the incision was made.

test_cases.description: Patient presented with unrelated symptoms post-surgery leading to unnecessary admission.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T09:00Z]: The patient was admitted for back pain post-surgery. After evaluation, it was determined that the pain was due to muscle strain unrelated to the surgical site. No signs of infection or hardware issues were noted.

required_provenance: admitted for back pain post-surgery

test_cases.description: Patient's symptoms of anxiety and panic unrelated to surgical recovery led to unplanned admission.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T13:00Z]: Following scoliosis surgery, the patient exhibited symptoms of anxiety and panic attacks. Evaluation revealed that these symptoms were not related to the surgical procedure, and the surgical recovery was progressing without issues.

required_provenance: symptoms of anxiety and panic attacks

test_cases.description: Patient presented with a pre-existing condition that required admission unrelated to scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-05T15:00Z]: Post-operative evaluation showed the patient was experiencing chest pain due to a known history of asthma exacerbation. The surgical site was stable, and there were no complications from the scoliosis procedure.

required_provenance: experiencing chest pain due to a known history of asthma exacerbation

test_cases.description: Patient's unrelated skin rash led to an unnecessary hospital admission post-surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-06T10:30Z]: The patient developed a rash on the abdomen which was determined to be an allergic reaction to medication. Evaluation confirmed the surgical site was clean, with no signs of infection or complications.

required_provenance: developed a rash on the abdomen which was determined to be an allergic reaction

test_cases.description: Patient with abdominal pain unrelated to surgical site after scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-01T11:00Z]: Patient presented with severe abdominal pain and was admitted for evaluation. Surgical site is clean with no signs of infection. Patient's pain is localized to the abdomen, unrelated to the back surgery.

required_provenance: Patient presented with severe abdominal pain and was admitted for evaluation.

test_cases.description: Patient readmitted with respiratory distress unrelated to surgical complications.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-02T09:30Z]: Patient was readmitted with respiratory distress. Evaluation reveals pneumonia, completely unrelated to recent scoliosis surgery. Surgical site remains intact and healing well.

required_provenance: Patient was readmitted with respiratory distress.

test_cases.description: Patient develops urinary retention unrelated to surgical intervention post scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-03T14:15Z]: Post-operative patient developed urinary retention. Imaging and bladder scan show no complications related to back surgery. Patient had pre-existing bladder issues.

required_provenance: Post-operative patient developed urinary retention.

test_cases.description: Patient admitted for an unrelated GI complication following scoliosis surgery.
test_cases.patient_payload: [MD 2025-01-04T08:45Z]: Patient presents with abdominal distension and was found to have an ileus. No signs of infection or issues at surgical site. This complication is unrelated to the recent scoliosis procedure.

required_provenance: Patient presents with abdominal distension and was found to have an ileus.
